result.execSummary:
The defendant Chris E. BRYAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Community First Credit Union; Shipbuilders Credit Union, Piggly Wiggly and Family Pantry.

Provide DNA sample.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

ADDRESS INFO for Chris E. BRYAN
Current: 2000 PROGRESS DRIVE, NEW LISBON CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTION, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 12-30-2016)
Prior: 826 South 196th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

It is ordered that the victim in this matter,Piggly Wiggly Aaron Jeske, 1339 N. 8th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220, is hereby awarded a judgment against the defendant, Chris E. Bryan in the sum of $1,373.40 dollars. 
It is ordered that the victim in this matter,Family Pantry Nishant Patel, 1807 Washington Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220, is hereby awarded a judgment against the defendant Chris E. Bryan in the sum of $719.00 dollars. 
  It is ordered that the victim in this matter,Shipbuilders Credit Union Attn: Mark Seidl 2001 Washington Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220, is hereby awarded a judgment against the defendant Chris E. Bryan in the sum of $2,332.50 dollars.
  It is ordered that the victim in this matter, Community First Credit Union, Cindy Pierce PO Box 1487, Appleton, WI 54912-1487 is hereby awarded a judgment against the defendant Chris E. Bryan in the sum of $1,450.00 dollars.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
Defendant is before the Court for sentencing after revocation, his probation having been revoked effective 10-26-16.   
Defendant is sentenced to six (6) months incarceration on each count concurrent and concurrent with his prison sentence on 15 CF 597.   
Court orders civil judgments of restitution against the defendant as follows:  $1,373.40 to Piggly Wiggly; $719.00 to Family Pantry; $2,332.50 to Shipbuilders Credit Union and $1,450.00 to Community First Credit Union.  
Court orders costs to be converted to civil judgment.   
Defendant is given 30 days credit.   
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a sentencing after revocation on 11-23-16 at 10:30 a.m.
Copy filed.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Sentencing Hearing on 11-23-2016 at 11:00 a.m.
Copy filed.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Adding counts 19 through 25, misdemeanor theft, contrary to Section 943.20(1)(d).

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-30-15 at 10:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 12-18-15 at 10:00 a.m.    Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department and the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Family Pantry, United One Credit Union, Shipbuilders and Piggly Wiggly.   Bail furnished.
